definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract

sentences.english: Touch and move trigger of catapult and see changes of power.
sentences.chinese: 觸摸和移動觸發彈射器，看到力的轉變。

sentences.english: Touchscreens are generally considered the next step in HIDD human driven interfaces.
sentences.chinese: 觸摸屏一般被認爲是下一步HIDD人力驅動接口。

sentences.english: For her part, she insists touch-screens will soon be owned by everyone.
sentences.chinese: 對於她來說，她堅信觸摸屏會很快普及。

sentences.english: She bent to touch the leaves of a plant or to smell a flower.
sentences.chinese: 她彎下腰去觸摸植物的葉子或花的氣味。

sentences.english: Visitors are requested not to touch the exhibits.
Some of monkeys were touching their left ear with their righthand .
sentences.chinese: 一些猴子正在用他們的右手觸摸他們的左耳。

sentences.english: The water is oily to the touch.
Matter groans to touch your hand.
sentences.chinese: 物質呻吟着觸摸着你的手。

sentences.english: PLC control, human-computer touch-screen, practical function and easy operation.
sentences.chinese: PLC控制，人機畫面觸摸屏，功能實用，操作簡便。

sentences.english: If touching sign, display this little cartoon bubble.
sentences.chinese: 如果觸摸那個符號，就會顯示那些卡通小泡泡。

sentences.english: The touch screen is a five-incher and can be used for navigation and display.
sentences.chinese: 5英寸的觸摸屏，用做導航和顯示。

sentences.english: Please stick a piece of paper saying NO TOUCH on the glass counter.
sentences.chinese: 請在玻璃櫃上貼一張“請勿觸摸”的條子。

sentences.english: Touch your music wworriesching luminous full-screen video.
sentences.chinese: 觸摸你的音樂和手錶上的夜光全屏幕視頻。

sentences.english: Spirit should be the temple, wisdom to release the monks side by hand touching the edge repair figure of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 靈應寺內，智釋和尚正在邊用手觸摸邊修補佛像。

sentences.english: The Angel then moticed something and reached out and touched the woman's cheek.
sentences.chinese: 這時天使注意到什麼，伸出手觸摸女人的面頰。

definition: to touch/(fig.) to touch on (a matter)
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
